intro: Phlebochilus wanosus, commonly known as the Wanosus phlebocil, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in countries like Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
